item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

justaguy:

Don’t forget to call die() after sending a redirection header. Sorry to be nit-picky, but otherwise it looks good!

Oops. XD Thanks for the reminder.

Another Code Example:

function addPost($str1, $str2, $str3) {
		global $db;
		global $errors;
		if(empty($str1) || empty($str2)) {
			$errors .= "You've left a field empty.";
		}
		if(strlen($str1) > 75) {
			$errors .= "The post title cannot be longer than 140 characters.";
		}
		if(strlen($str2) > 10000) {
			$errors .= "Your message cannot be greater than 10,000 characters.";
		}
		if($str3 != $_SESSION['admin']) {
			$errors .= "Invalid key.";
		}
		if(empty($errors)) {
			$stmt = $db->prepare("INSERT INTO posts (title, message, date) VALUES (:title, :message, :date)");
			$stmt->bindParam(":title", $str1, PDO::PARAM_STR);
			$stmt->bindParam(":message", $str2, PDO::PARAM_STR);
			$stmt->bindParam(":date", date("m-d-y"), PDO::PARAM_STR);
			$stmt->execute();
			header("Location: index.php?module=blog");
			die();
		}
	}

item.title: Tweeaks Simple CMS
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

Tweeaks Simple CMS. I was looking for a super simple CMS without a steep learning curve to build off of - I simply don’t have time to teach myself WP backend or something of the sort. So I’ve decided to make my own. (Funny, don’t have time to learn but have time to make my own.)

Code Sample: (THIS IS ALL YOU GET MUHAHAHA)

	function updateSettings($str1, $str2) {
		global $db;
		$stmt = $db->prepare('UPDATE `settings` SET `site_status`=:site_status,`reg_active`= :reg_active WHERE 1');
		$stmt->bindValue(":site_status", $str1, PDO::PARAM_INT);
		$stmt->bindValue(":reg_active", $str2, PDO::PARAM_INT);
		$stmt->execute();
		header("Location: index.php?module=home");
	}
